job_details.degree_required: Bachelor's Degree in computer science, engineering or in a technology related field OR equivalent through a combination of education and/or technology experience OR 12 years of technology experience

jd: From: Hannah, Rwaltz hannah@rwaltz.com Reply to: hannah@rwaltz.com Snowflake Database AdministratorLocation: Frisco (CST) (at least two days on site per week)Position Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in computer science, engineering or in a technology related field OR equivalent through a combination of education and/or technology experience OR 12 years of technology experience 8 years of experience in Data Engineering, BI Engineering or related field in architecting and developing end-to-end scalable data applications 8 years of experience Snowflake database setup, administration, ERWIN modeling, designing, implementing enterprise data warehouse solutions with strong SQL query capabilities 8 years of experience implementing data governance, security, PII data handling, monitoring & alerting unauthorized data access, changes 6 years of experience in onboarding new data tools, configuring, integrating Snowflake with Informatica, BI, Analytical tools and with OKTA, SailPoint, CyberArk 8 years of experience managing compute & storage, applying best practices for schema, table, DDL creations, querying, evaluating load operations & performance 6 years of working knowledge of different databases (e.g., SQL & NoSQL), S3 datalake, CICD, Jenkins and AWS cloud technologies; leveraging SQL or Python programming languages 6 years of experience developing strong collaborative relationships with key business, technology and data teams 6 years of experience in working with data engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes and testingLicenses/Certificates:Snowflake SnowPro, Advance Architect Certification is a must Amazon Web Services (AWS) Solution Architect or Certified Data Analytics
